12.7.17  2:46 am   your history of the world video @ 12m43s, you say Columbus discovers japan.  I assume that's intentional as a joke cause we all know it's wrong?  makes me wonder if there are other similar incorrect stuff in the video purposely put there to mess with us?

     there is a persistent rumor that he thought cuba and hispanola were parts of china and japan. so using a little slight of hand i was able to twist the map during the atlantic voyage so that when we arrive at cuba, it almost looks like japan. i was considering labeling it "not japan" on the screen, i may or may not have done that, i can't remember because i haven't seen the video since it was released

11.29.17  3:44 pm   11.28.17  11:19 pm (i still don't understand how to link these things) So I guess the harder and dumber question is: Do you have any recommendations on how to chose just one thing to start doing?

     Do I have to wait to feel the GROOVE tickle me before doing music, of however it is you relate to a medium? Should I just throw some darts into an arts and crafts magazine? i got a nosebleed god save me


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201711282319

11.28.17  11:19 pm   How did you settle mainly on the mediums of music/video? There are so many things to be good at, but they all take so much time, and you should probably start with just one, so how do you chose which? 

     music was first, and has been most important, for as long as i can remember. then you realize it is essential to connect it to the visual experience, because that is really what anchors it, and gives the music its true power. and in the age of the internet and personal computers, the approach i am taking seemed to make the most sense, and allows me to do everything myself. which is important because i am a total perfectionist, and also mentally insane

html:
11.13.17  7:29 pm   8.20.16  8:22 am Hey i was looking through the random questions and saw this one. Is it true that the songwriters usually make more money than the singer of the tune does? I think it happens a lot that songwriters and the session musicians aren't really credited on the albums. This isn't new either. You look at like old motown records or something and all you see is the name of the singer. When I find an instrumental part I really like, it's always a chore to figure out who was actually playing on that album. Although I guess nowadays, pop artists don't really make most of their money through album sales and stuff like that anymore. 


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201608200822

8.20.16  8:22 am   do u think songwriters should be credited more clearly? for instance many hit songs are mainly credited to the singer, with the writers being credited in the fine print

html:
11.2.17  6:26 pm   Why do Americans write the day and month in dates backwards?

10.20.17  7:21 am
embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201710200721

10.20.17  7:21 am   Why can't Americans write dates in the correct order or at least like a logical order or something?

      it's based on the way it is spoken. the year is last because it is usually the least important in conversation, and the reason it is month-day and not day-month is because it is fewer syllables to say month-day. this combination of circumstances is what resulted in the date format. you might think this creates an imperfect logistical outcome, but it is important to remember that when dealing with computers and numerical sorting, it is done in the logistically correct way
original_html:
11.2.17  6:26 pm   Why do Americans write the day and month in dates backwards?

10.20.17  7:21 am

answers_original.html:
10.20.17  7:21 am   Why can't Americans write dates in the correct order or at least like a logical order or something?

      it's based on the way it is spoken. the year is last because it is usually the least important in conversation, and the reason it is month-day and not day-month is because it is fewer syllables to say month-day. this combination of circumstances is what resulted in the date format. you might think this creates an imperfect logistical outcome, but it is important to remember that when dealing with computers and numerical sorting, it is done in the logistically correct way
